Yum Phonlamai Recipe | Bon Appétit

The interplay between the fish sauce, chiles, and sweet juicy fruits makes this a simple but refreshing dish.Ingredients4 Servings1Tbsp. small dried shrimp (optional)¼cup unsweetened shredded coconut4garlic cloves2red Thai chiles, coarsely chopped4Tbsp. fresh lime juice4tsp. granulated sugar4tsp. fish sauce2apples, preferably Pink Lady, cored, cut into 1" pieces2Asian pears, cored, cut into 2" pieces1small shallot, thinly sliced into rings1cup red grapes, halved crosswise¼cup coarsely chopped cilantro¼cup mint leaves, torn if largePreparationStep 1If using, toast dried shrimp in a dry small skillet, tossing occasionally, over medium heat until slightly lighter in appearance and a little crispy, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board; reserve skillet. Coarsely chop and lightly smash to tenderize; set aside.Step 2Add coconut to reserved skillet and toast over medium heat until light golden and fragrant, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a small bowl; set aside.Step 3Smash garlic to a coarse paste with a mortar and pestle. Add chiles and lightly smash (the finer you pound the chiles, the spicier the dressing will be). Mix in lime juice, sugar, fish sauce, and 2 Tbsp. water. (Or, finely chop garlic and salt, then chiles, on a cutting board and smash with the side of a chef’s knife. Mix in a bowl with remaining ingredients.)Step 4Toss apples, pears, shallot, grapes, cilantro, mint, and reserved dried shrimp (if using) in a large bowl to combine. Add dressing and toss to coat.
